summary: This is a chain of FBI emails from September 2019 discussing victim services for Jeffrey Epstein's victims. It details meetings with six victims, coordination with attorney Gloria Allred, and internal discussions about victim compensation applications and jurisdictional issues.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who took the FBI agent's business card and mentioned she has two more victims she will refer for services.

events.title: FBI meets with Epstein victims
events.description: An FBI agent met with a total of six victims, provided them with resource packets and brochures, conducted risk assessments, discussed therapy options, and provided emotional support.

events.title: Discussion on victim compensation eligibility
events.description: An email from the Office of Victim Services (OVS) indicates that victims could potentially receive compensation if a letter from a DA or AUSA states they would have prosecuted if the case had been brought in a timely manner.

keyFacts: An FBI agent met with six victims of Jeffrey Epstein and provided them with victim services resources, counseling referrals, and emotional support.
Attorney Gloria Allred was involved, indicating she had two more victims to refer to the FBI for services.
There was confusion and internal FBI coordination regarding victim compensation applications, specifically whether victims who disclosed abuse years later were still eligible.
The email chain reveals logistical issues, such as a victim in Lake Havasu being told to go to Las Vegas for services, indicating jurisdictional challenges.
The correspondence shows active FBI victim assistance efforts in September 2019, following Epstein's death in August 2019.
